intro: Mapania lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mapania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Mapania lancifolia is often found in forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
